message.content:
To get to the grocery store that is 1km away in Estonia, there are a few options depending on your preference and the available means of transportation:

1. Walking: If the weather is suitable and you enjoy walking, consider taking a walk to the grocery store. It will take approximately 10-15 minutes to cover 1km on foot.

2. Cycling: Estonia has a good network of bike lanes, so cycling could be a convenient and environmentally friendly option. You can rent a bicycle if you don't own one.

3. Public transportation: Check if there is a bus or tram route that goes in the direction of the grocery store. Utilizing public transportation can be cost-effective and efficient. You can find the nearest bus or tram stop and plan your route accordingly.

4. Car-sharing/Ridesharing: If you have access to car-sharing services or ridesharing apps like Uber or Bolt, you can consider using them to reach the grocery store. This option offers convenience and flexibility.

5. Taxi: Hailing a taxi is always an option if you prefer a more direct and private mode of transportation. You can find taxi stands or use taxi-hailing apps to book a ride.

Consider the weather, time constraints, cost, and your personal preferences to determine the most suitable mode of transportation for your trip to the grocery store.
